posts.post_content:
As a comment relating to Silverware's comment... sacking Children of Korlis doesnt "prevent" anything. It simply gains life back that youve lost in last 1 turn. For example If you were to take loss of life to 0 life or below then sacrificing Children of Korlis will not save you from fatal dammage. You will have already lost the game.
  
   
It is a good life buyback. I suggest using it with [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond) and [Lin Sivvi, Defiant Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lin Sivvi, Defiant Hero) to backfire dammage back to an opponent.
posts.html:
As a comment relating to Silverware's comment... sacking Children of Korlis doesnt "prevent" anything. It simply gains life back that youve lost in last 1 turn. For example If you were to take loss of life to 0 life or below then sacrificing Children of Korlis will not save you from fatal dammage. You will have already lost the game.

It is a good life buyback. I suggest using it with Sanguine Bond and Lin Sivvi, Defiant Hero to backfire dammage back to an opponent.

posts.post_content:
@pixieCrack  
  
Why wouldn't you just play [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) on turn one with that hand, and take the life loss? I mean what is your opponent going to do with 1 mana anyway? Either they play 1 next turn, or you annihilate the first one and next turn he plays one.  
  
I can't think of any 1 cost answers to Emrakul  
  
EDIT  
  
I guess there's [Innocent Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Innocent Blood) and [Seal of Removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of Removal), I dunno why you would summon a creature at a cost of life when they have a [Seal of Removal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of Removal) out but whatever  
  
There are a few ways, most of them you are now both at five life
